title: Immersive Virtual Reality-Based Bauhaus Design History Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic design terminology and comprehension of contemporary design trends
context.additional_context: Conducting experiential learning through shared VR devices in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, with case-centered structuring to enhance job relevance for current practitioners.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the three core principles of Bauhaus design (functionality, practicality, aesthetics) in an immersive VR environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can analyze spatial composition principles of representative Bauhaus works through VR simulations and propose three or more practical applications.
Learners can create visual materials illustrating trends in user experience (UX) changes within the historical context of design through VR-based collaborative tasks.

resources: Mobile VR Device Sets (10 sets, shared by 5-person teams)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
